annotation.TEXT: This segment will mostly be focusing on a few extra things before moving onto the next set of main stages (via a vote, which you can find more information on towards the end of the video). For now however, I'm mostly going to focus on the overworld encounters, buying a few upgrades, and dealing with a specific optional boss that I mentioned a while ago.

This isn't exactly the last we've seen of Mr. Hat, as you can probably tell. If you drop down to the roofs from the airship above, you can eventually reach and talk with him. He'll give you a bit of extra gold in return, and will seem to hop off to another location. You can follow him around and talk with him two more times before he heads off for good. Just make sure to have the catapult unlocked for the third time, otherwise you won't be able to talk with him (leaving the town and coming back also causes him to go away, so it's best to beat the second set of stages before doing all this).
Note: The poll on this video is now over, as the next level has already been decided. Please do not send in any more votes.

The second fight with the Black Knight isn't any tougher than the first one. He has a bit more health this time around, and he's gained a new attack where he shovels up debris at you. He also has a new backdash ability, and can now fire his projectiles while jumping. Beyond that however, not much else has changed with his overall pattern.
Despite every urge probably telling you not to waste your gold on this, you'll actually get even more back after the events that follow (especially if you trigger the extra scenes afterwards).

Just to note: Yes, I realized I passed up the health upgrade from the Gastronomer. I guess a part of me did this as a bit of a self-imposed challenge for the next boss (even though I bothered to actually get a few upgrades before fighting him). In any case, said boss is located back in the armory village. If you've already beaten the second set of main stages, a catapult will appear in both villages for fast travel (which is also necessary to unlock for not only another part of the armory village, but also to gain all the parts of a small easter egg as well).

Mr. Hat is another of the Guest Director enemies, and is one of the only optional bosses that isn't encountered as a wandering NPC on the map. As suggested by his speech, Mr. Hat can switch up his fighting style by wearing different hats (which he only ever seems to use two of, sadly). I'd say he's fair bit more difficult than Baz, although I somehow managed to do even better against him than almost every other boss so far.
